title: Headless POS
text: This application is specifically designed to facilitate customer service using a Headless POS system. In addition to supporting cash and card payments, the Headless POS also includes functionalities for discounts and refunds. Here are some key points to note: - The Headless POS utilizes the Currency and Language settings configured in the Backoffice. These settings determine the default locale of the Headless POS, including formatting conventions for numbers and currencies (such as decimal or comma separators, and whether the currency symbol appears before or after the value). - The application will display the logo associated with the shop, which is obtained from the Backoffice's Shop Logo setting. - For live implementations, the use of a Pin Entry Device is required to process card payments. This necessitates having a K3 Connector, a compatible printer, a supported Payment Terminal, and a Payment Service Provider. However, for demonstration and testing purposes without a Connector, a Virtual payment option is available. - It's important to note that this application is designed to run on dedicated kiosk hardware without keyboard input. To prevent unintended actions, it is recommended to utilize Google Chrome's Kiosk mode, which helps prevent users from holding down the touch screen for extended periods and simulating a right-click action.
description:
This application is specifically designed to facilitate customer service using a Headless POS system. In addition to supporting cash and card payments, the Headless POS also includes functionalities for discounts and refunds.


Here are some key points to note:


- The Headless POS utilizes the Currency and Language settings configured in the Backoffice. These settings determine the default locale of the Headless POS, including formatting conventions for numbers and currencies (such as decimal or comma separators, and whether the currency symbol appears before or after the value).


- The application will display the logo associated with the shop, which is obtained from the Backoffice's Shop Logo setting.


- For live implementations, the use of a Pin Entry Device is required to process card payments. This necessitates having a K3 Connector, a compatible printer, a supported Payment Terminal, and a Payment Service Provider. However, for demonstration and testing purposes without a Connector, a Virtual payment option is available.


- It's important to note that this application is designed to run on dedicated kiosk hardware without keyboard input. To prevent unintended actions, it is recommended to utilize Google Chrome's Kiosk mode, which helps prevent users from holding down the touch screen for extended periods and simulating a right-click action.

title: Start Screen
text: From the Start Screen of the application, users have the ability to temporarily change the language by selecting the dropdown menu located in the right-hand corner. They can then choose the desired language from the options provided. However, it's important to note that the language selection will revert to the default language after each transaction is completed. To set up languages, navigate to the Self Serve Admin section and select the desired shop. Under the languages tab, you can add and configure various languages according to your requirements. The image displayed on the Start Screen is customizable through the Visual Profiles of the Visual Composer. Simply access the Assets tab to configure and upload the desired image. Please keep in mind that if the application remains unused for a certain period, the Hpos (Headless POS) will automatically return to the Start Screen. The duration of this idle timeout is determined by the Idle Timeout Settings in the Configuration.

text: TOC TO BE ADDED ONCE COMPLETED Composer View The Composer View is the main screen used within the application. The clerk uses this screen to select which items the customer is ordering. The screen will always display the Landing Group for the selected store as the starting point for navigation. The Hierarchy and navigation can be expanded and customised further using the Composer Groups and Visual Composer Modules. You can choose to drill into the subgroups (Blue tiles) to see another layer of the hierarchy, or you can use the +/- buttons to add your items to the basket. If you press the + on an item which is a Bundle or has Modifiers, you will be asked to make your selections before adding to the basket. IMAGE REQUIRED On-screen navigation - If you have Bundle Groups set up, you will see navigation buttons appear when in those groups. For example Home > Drinks > Pepsi / Sprite / Coke. you can use this to return to the Home Screen or a section by selecting the POS. ICON REQUIRED Tile Button The The tile button if pressed will return you to your home group from wherever you are in the application. ICON REQUIRED Supervisor Functions This button will ask you for a PIN code to enter supervisor functions. ICON REQUIRED Product Information Any tile with the I symbol means there is some more information you might want to see for an item. It also indicates that there may be Bundle Groups or Modifiers for the item when selected. ICON REQUIRED Basket Button The basket button shows you how many items you have in your basket. You can press the button to view the basket, which you have to do to proceed to Payment. Items, Bundles and Modifiers When you add a Bundle or Modifiable item to your basket, you will be prompted to make the relevant selections before adding them to the basket. If your Bundle main item has Modifiers linked to it, it will automatically take you to the Modifiers tab if you wish to make any alterations. IMAGE REQUIRED Non-bundled items with Modifiers will only show you the Modifiers. The min-max rule for selections is displayed next to the Modifier title, You will also see any additional prices for the modifiers. Modifications that you make get printed on the order confirmation slip and also make their way through to the Order Status Display to be used in the order preparation area. IMAGE REQUIRED Basket The Basket screen is a listing of all of your items, along with any bundle selections and modifiers you have made. They are grouped, so if you have made more than one item with the same selections and modifiers they will be on the same basket line. It denotes the extended price of the basket line and also displays the quantity multiplied by the single item price. IMAGE REQUIRED ICON REQUIRED Edit Line You can use the pencil icon for the basket line to make alterations to that line (change modifiers or bundle selections). ICON REQUIRED Delete Line Use the trash can icon to remove the line from the basket. ICON REQUIRED Delete Basket Use the black trash can next to the Pay button to clear the basket and return to the start screen.

title: Supervisory Functions
text: To access the Supervisor Functions, follow these steps: 1. Locate the settings cog icon in the top right-hand corner of the POS screen. 2. Click on the cog icon, and you will be prompted to enter a supervisor PIN. Supervisor permissions are set up in the Configuration. NEW IMAGE REQUIRED Here are the available Supervisor Functions: - Previous Receipt: This option allows you to view the previous receipt and provides the choice to either email it or print it. - Full Screen: Clicking this button will toggle the full-screen mode on or off. Please note that this function may not work with Chrome due to specific browser settings. - Choose Payment Provider: This function lists all the payment providers that you have set up in the Admin section. If you don't have a payment provider or if you are performing a demo or test, you can select the "Virtual" option. The Virtual payment bypasses the actual payment process and assumes a full payment has been made. However, please note that the Virtual option should not be used in a live environment. - Refund Mode: Selecting this option allows you to enter Refund Mode, where the entire transaction is treated as a refund. - Logout: Clicking this button will empty the basket and return you to the login screen. Please ensure that you have the necessary supervisor permissions and use these functions responsibly and by your operational requirements.
description:
To access the Supervisor Functions, follow these steps:


1. Locate the settings cog icon in the top right-hand corner of the POS screen.

2. Click on the cog icon, and you will be prompted to enter a supervisor PIN. Supervisor permissions are set up in the Configuration.


NEW IMAGE REQUIRED


Here are the available Supervisor Functions:


- Previous Receipt: This option allows you to view the previous receipt and provides the choice to either email it or print it.


- Full Screen: Clicking this button will toggle the full-screen mode on or off. Please note that this function may not work with Chrome due to specific browser settings.


- Choose Payment Provider: This function lists all the payment providers that you have set up in the Admin section. If you don't have a payment provider or if you are performing a demo or test, you can select the "Virtual" option. The Virtual payment bypasses the actual payment process and assumes a full payment has been made. However, please note that the Virtual option should not be used in a live environment.


- Refund Mode: Selecting this option allows you to enter Refund Mode, where the entire transaction is treated as a refund.


- Logout: Clicking this button will empty the basket and return you to the login screen.


Please ensure that you have the necessary supervisor permissions and use these functions responsibly and by your operational requirements.

title: Payments & Receipts
text: Payment At the bottom of the Basket screen, you will have your payment options. You can choose your payment method to use and you can split your payment types in use as well. NEW IMAGE REQUIRED A Card payment type will initiate communications with the Connector that has been configured to use for a real EFT payment. A Cash payment will also utilise the connector in order to pop the cash drawer. A Manual Card payment does not use an integrated card terminal and is designed for use with stand-alone chip and pin. it only requires the connector for receipt printing. If the payment fails, you will be advised and after 5 seconds it will return you the basket to try another card. You should refer to the PED for details on why the transaction was declined, as each provider is different, so we only display a failure. NOTE: You will also see a failure if the Simple POS is unable to communicate with the Connector. NEW IMAGE REQUIRED If the payment is successful, the transaction will be submitted into Imagine's back-end for onward processing. It will now. Submit the order to the Order Status Display. Return you an order number which is displayed on screen and used in the OSD and ORB. Print an order confirmation slip including the order number and any bundle selections and modifiers which are applied. Show you the estimated waiting time, which it calculates based upon the last 15 minutes order throughput. Before returning the user back to the start screen. NEW IMAGE REQUIRED Refund Mode Refund mode is available in the Supervisor Functions. When you are in Refund mode, the entire transaction is classified as a refund. There is no ability to perform an exchange. When you are in refund mode it is very clear in order to ensure you do not make a mistake. NEW IMAGE REQUIRED Discount After registering an item against the POS there are options available to discount them. These options will be detailed below. NEW IMAGE REQUIRED NEW ICON Clicking one of these will set the percentage discount against the item(s) in the basket. NEW ICON Clicking onto ‘Custom Discount’ brings up a dialogue allowing the users to choose to discount by a percentage or a set amount. NEW IMAGE REQUIRED Once the discount has been entered press ‘Apply Discount’. This will then set the amount or percentage against the product in the basket. NEW IMAGE REQUIRED
